page.title: 12LAW AND ORDER part 2
page.content: Some of the most common crimes of the Twentieth Century are burglary, theft and vandalism. In 1984 700,000 homes were broken into in England and Wales. This disturbing trend has led to the instigation of Neighbourhood Watch schemes in recent years. There has been greater liaison. between the public and the police, who can advise on safeguarding homes. Recommended measures are security chains on doors, and such, fanlight or arm locks for windows. It is also advisable to mark property either by permanent or invisible marking. In South Norwood itself,there are 40 burglaries a week,the majority of which occur between between 12 and 2am The Neighbourhood Watch scheme,in this area as in most others has proved successful in acting as a deterent and house crime decreased dramatically.
